Description: DFine Inc. of San Jose, Calif., agreed to pay $2.39 million to resolve allegations under the False Claims Act that it paid kickbacks to induce physicians to use certain of the company's devices that are used in treating spinal fractures.

Merit Medical Systems agreed to pay $18 million to resolve allegations that it offered unlawful kickbacks to health care providers to persuade them to purchase Merit medical devices and caused false claims to be submitted to government health care programs. The settlement was also announced by state attorneys general; see separate entry.

Merit Medical Systems agreed to pay $18 million to resolve multistate allegations that it offered unlawful kickbacks to health care providers to persuade them to purchase Merit medical devices and caused false claims to be submitted to government health care programs. The settlement was also announced by the U.S. Justice Department; see separate entry.
